author: A_Brickset_user
title: You can not do anything with this set.
review: I got this at McDonalds, actually two.  And it was a real disapointment.  There's nothing you can do to play with this.  The pieces don't work with other legos.  It's just not a playable toy.  We also got the basketball player, but that was equally unusable.  At least the ball got some play.

author: redbeardlegoman
title: Wide of the net.
review:
I love going to yard sales.  You never know what treasures you'll dig up.  In reality though, you're going to dig up a lot more dirt than gold.  This is some dirt I dug up, and kept, for reasons unknown.

It was there.  It was ten cents.  It was unopened.  I'd never seen it before, so I thought, "how can I go wrong for a dime?"

I'd like my dime back, actually.

This toy doesn't really do anything.  I know it's supposed to shoot the puck, but it doesn't, really.  It doesn't look good.  It has no pieces compatible with any of my Lego.  It's not a big minifigure, which would be cool, and totally worth it on its own.  It is, however, a sad and broken dream.  A glimmer of fool's gold.  Painted dross.  Crap.

If you obsessively, compulsively, uncontrollably have to own every bit of Lego merchandising out there, you'll have to get this to complete your collection.  That's the only way you could love this... lump of plastic Lego mockery.

Pros

  • I'm only out a dime.

Cons

  • Ugly.
  • Doesn't do what it's supposed to do, and wouldn't be all that interesting if it did.
  • Incompatible with anything but the other mutants in its line.
  • Not even a big minifigure.  It's a lump with a big fake minifigure head on it.
  • It left a trail of tears from old and young Lego maniacs criss-crossing North America.

This would be better off recycled as a sports bottle.  Can I leave a zero ranking, please?
